comments:
Using 3.3.

I'm finding that once in a great while I'm profiling an application, and I see
my agent in the profiling monitor, but then I get about 10 error dialogs saying
that an error has occured. This is the only symptom I see - everything is
working fine and the data comes in and I can view it.

This is not consistently reproducible. I've experienced this once a long time
ago in windows, and just now in linux. I do recall that when I saw this in
windows, there seemed to be an empty root node next to my monitor, with no
label, but you could see the dotted line showing the tree structure leading to
it. I'll make more careful observations next time I see this, and show it to one
of you.

Since you probably won't be able to reproduce this, I was hoping you could
inspect the code and see what might possibly be going wrong here. If you can't
find the problem, then we can resort to adding more exception handling and null
checks.

Here's the exception I get over and over...

I look at the viewer code as well as its content and label providers, and I
don't see any null value return there, each element and its label in the tree
should not be null. For now, I will catch and log any exception raised.

Attching the patch for the fix, and I'll close the defect for now, if you can
reproduce the problem, please reopen with more information.

Thanks a lot

Created an attachment (id=28793)
patch for i3
Closing. Will reopen if problem reappears.
